H0.text: Reproduction occurs rapidly is the advantage that the offspring of a dandelion have by reproducing asexually.

H1.text: Reproductive competition is increased is the advantage that the offspring of a dandelion have by reproducing asexually.

H2.text: Mating compatibility improves is an advantage for the offspring of a dandelion that reproduce asexually.

H3.text: Diversity increases between generations is the advantage that dandelion offspring enjoy when they reproduce asexually.

A4.text: Many Taraxacum species produce seeds asexually by apomixis, where the seeds are produced without pollination, resulting in offspring that are genetically identical to the parent plant.

A5.text: Vegetative reproduction allows plants to circumvent the immature seedling phase and reach the mature phase faster.

A6.text: Vegetative reproduction is not evolutionary advantageous; it does not allow for genetic diversity and could lead plants to accumulate deleterious mutations.
